issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

epic.name: GDPR analytics update
epic.summary: Update analytics and provide GDPR features

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The SDK sends an analytics event app or module is created or built which contains the project directory. We don't do anything with this data and it leaks the username, so it must be removed.
fields.summary: Remove project directory from analytics payloads

comments.body:
Ti SDK master PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/10085
Ti SDK 7_2_X PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/10086

Ti Windows master PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile_windows/pull/1250
Ti Windows 7_2_X PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile_windows/pull/1251
Note that I've requested Gary review the Windows PRs, but feel free to steal it from him.

Project dir is no longer present in the analytics payload, verified on PEM.

*ENV*
{noformat}
SDK Ver: 7.3.0.v20180604180041, 7.2.0.v20180605053055
OS Ver: 10.13.5, 1803
Appc NPM: 4.2.13
Appc CLI: 7.0.4-master.3
Ti CLI Ver: 5.1.1
Node Ver: 8.9.4, 8.9.1
NPM Ver: 6.0.0, 5.7.1
{noformat}

*Closing*
